maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more Server Management Gateways
The Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway cmdlet gets one or more Azure Server Management Gateways.
The name of the resource group in which to retrieve gateways.
The name of the resource group in which to retrieve gateways.
The name of the server management gateway to retrieve.
When GatewayName is specified, Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway will include detailed status on the gateway.
A Gateway that will be retrieved.
This will use the ResourceGroupName and GatewayName from the specified Gateway to perform the action.
When Gateway is specified, Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway will include detailed status on the gateway.
The name of the resource group in which to retrieve gateways.
The name of the server management gateway to retrieve.
When GatewayName is specified, Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway will include detailed status on the gateway.
A Gateway that will be retrieved.
This will use the ResourceGroupName and GatewayName from the specified Gateway to perform the action.
When Gateway is specified, Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway will include detailed status on the gateway.

maml:alert.maml:para: If Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway is use without parameters, it will return all the Gateways associated with the subscription.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all gateways in the subscription

Resource Group Location Auto Upgrade Gateway Name -------------- -------- ------------ ------------ groupOne centralus Off mygateway groupOne centralus Off othergateway groupTwo centralus On privategateway

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Retrieve gateways for in a resource group --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Resource Group Location Auto Upgrade Gateway Name -------------- -------- ------------ ------------ myGroup centralus Off mygateway
Name Installed Version Operating System ---- --------- ------- ---------------- GATEWAYPC 4/13/2016 6:35:04 PM 1.0.1104.0 Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more Server Management Nodes
The Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway cmdlet gets one or more Azure Server Management Gateways.
The name of the resource group in which to retrieve nodes.
The name of the node to retrieve.
An existing Node from which to pull the ResourceGroupName and the NodeName.
The name of the resource group in which to retrieve nodes.
The name of the node to retrieve.
An existing Node from which to pull the ResourceGroupName and the NodeName.
Gets a Server Management Session
The Get-AzureRmServerManagementGateway cmdlet gets a single Azure Server Management Session.
The name of the resource group in which to retrieve the session
The name of the node where the session is located.
The name of the session to retrieve.
The name of the session to retrieve.
An exiting Session object that is used to pull the ResourceGroupName, the NodeName and the SessionName
An exiting Node object that is used to pull the ResourceGroupName and the NodeName (SessionName is still required)
The name of the resource group in which to retrieve the session
The name of the node where the session is located.
The name of the session to retrieve.
An exiting Session object that is used to pull the ResourceGroupName, the NodeName and the SessionName
An exiting Node object that is used to pull the ResourceGroupName and the NodeName (SessionName is still required)
Installs a Server Management Gateway Profile (profile.json)
Installs an Azure Server Management Gateway Profile (profile.json) into the correct location.
The name of the local file that contains the gateway profile to install.
The file should have been previously retrieved with Save-AzureRmServerManagementGatewayProfile
The name of the local file that contains the gateway profile to install.
The file should have been previously retrieved with Save-AzureRmServerManagementGatewayProfile
Executes a PowerShell ScriptBlock on a node
Executes a PowerShell ScriptBlock on a node managed by an Azure Server Management Gateway.
The name of the resource group where the node exists.
The name of the node to execute the script block on.
The name of the Session to manage the node.
The scriptblock to execute on the target node.
The name of the powershell runspace on the target node.
When specified, returns the complete object that contains the output from the node.
The Session to use to connect to the target node.
May be specified instead of ResourceGroupName, NodeName, SessionName, and PowerShellSessionName.
The scriptblock to execute on the target node.
The name of the powershell runspace on the target node.
When specified, returns the complete object that contains the output from the node.
The name of the resource group where the node exists.
The name of the node to execute the script block on.
The name of the Session to manage the node.
The scriptblock to execute on the target node.
The name of the powershell runspace on the target node.
When specified, returns the complete object that contains the output from the node.
The Session to use to connect to the target node.
May be specified instead of ResourceGroupName, NodeName, SessionName, and PowerShellSessionName.
Creates a new Server Management Gateway
Creates a new Azure Server Management Gateway
The name of the resource group in which to create the gateway.
The name of the gateway to create.
The Location in which to create the gateway.
If specified, the gateway will auto upgrade itself when a new version is released.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Gateway from other Azure resources.
The name of the resource group in which to create the gateway.
The name of the gateway to create.
The Location in which to create the gateway.
If specified, the gateway will auto upgrade itself when a new version is released.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Gateway from other Azure resources.
Create a new Server Management Node
Creates a new Azure Server Management Node
The name of the resource group in which to create the node.
The name of the Gateway that will be used to access the Node
The Location in which to create the Node.
The name of the Node
The Computer Name of the computer that is being managed.
Credentials used to access the managed node.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs.
A Gateway that is used to manage the node.
This can be used instead of ResourceGroupName, GatewayName, and Location.
The name of the Node
The Computer Name of the computer that is being managed.
Credentials used to access the managed node.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs.
The name of the resource group in which to create the node.
The name of the Gateway that will be used to access the Node
The Location in which to create the Node.
The name of the Node
The Computer Name of the computer that is being managed.
Credentials used to access the managed node.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs.
A Gateway that is used to manage the node.
This can be used instead of ResourceGroupName, GatewayName, and Location.
Creates a new Server Management Session
Creates a new Azure Server Management Session
The ResourceGroup of the node to create a session for.
The Name of the node on which to create a session.
The name to use for the session.
The credentials to use to manage the node.
The node to create the session on.
May be used instead of ResourceGroupName and NodeName.
The name to use for the session.
The credentials to use to manage the node.
The ResourceGroup of the node to create a session for.
The Name of the node on which to create a session.

command:parameter.maml:name: SessionName

maml:description.maml:para: The name to use for the session.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Defaults to a randomly created string.

maml:description.maml:para: The credentials to use to manage the node.
The node to create the session on.
May be used instead of ResourceGroupName and NodeName.
Removes a Server Management Gateway
Removes an Azure Server Management Gateway.
The name of the resource group in which to remove the gateway.
The name of the gateway to remove.
A Gateway to remove.
This may be used instead of passing in the ResourceGroupName and the GatewayName.
The name of the resource group in which to remove the gateway.
The name of the gateway to remove.
A Gateway to remove.
This may be used instead of passing in the ResourceGroupName and the GatewayName.

maml:alert.maml:para: All the nodes in the Gateway must be removed before using this; otherwise this will fail.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a Server Management Node
Removes an Azure Server Management Node
The name of the resource group in which to remove a node.
The Name of the node to remove.
The Node to remove
May be used instead of specifying ResourceGroupName and NodeName
The name of the resource group in which to remove a node.
The Name of the node to remove.
The Node to remove
May be used instead of specifying ResourceGroupName and NodeName
Closes a Server Management Session
Closes an Azure Server Management Session
The name of the resource group in which to close the session.
The name of the node on which to close the session
The session name to close.
The session name to close.
The Session to close.
May be used instead of specifying ResourceGroupName, NodeName and SessionName.
The name of the resource group in which to close the session.
The name of the node on which to close the session
The session name to close.
The Session to close.
May be used instead of specifying ResourceGroupName, NodeName and SessionName.
Resets the Profile of a Server Management gateway
This regenerates the profile for an Azure Server Management Gateway.
After this, the profile will need to be downloaded (Save-AzureRmServerManagementGatewayProfile) and installed (Install-AzureRmServerManagementGatewayProfile)
The name of the resource group for the gateway to reset.
The name of the gateway.
A Gateway to regenerate the profile for.
May be specified instead of ResourceGoupName and GatewayName
The name of the resource group for the gateway to reset.
The name of the gateway.
A Gateway to regenerate the profile for.
May be specified instead of ResourceGoupName and GatewayName
Downloads the Profile for a Server Management Gateway and stores it in a local file
Downloads the Profile (profile.json) for an Azure Server Management Gateway and stores it in a local file.
The local file in which to save the profile data.
The name of the resource group for the gateway.
The Name of the gateway to get the profile for.
The local file in which to save the profile data.
A Gateway to get the profile for.
May be used instead of specifying ResourceGroupName and GatewayName
The local file in which to save the profile data.
The name of the resource group for the gateway.
The Name of the gateway to get the profile for.
A Gateway to get the profile for.
May be used instead of specifying ResourceGroupName and GatewayName
